trial_identification.studytitle: Effect of Olive Leaf Extract on gene expression, diet and energy in healthy male participants
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effect of Olive Leaf Extract on gene expression, diet and energy in healthy male participants

interventions.interventions: It is an Olive Leaf Extract, made by Comvita Ltd. Currently on the market. 10ml twice a day 8 weeks taken oral- in a liquid, given a measuring spoon bottles of Olive Leaf extract returned at end to measure how much was taken
interventions.comparator:
Placebo:
Vegetable glycerin and flavours and colours listed below. Sucrose octa acetate Caramel colour Damascenone Guaiacol Eugenol
in liquid form, to be taken same quantities as Olive leaf extract

primaryOutcome.outcome: Gene expression will be analysed from blood samples, this will include inflammatory markers such as IL-8, COX-2 and TNF
primaryOutcome.timepoint: after participants have been recruited they will take the supplement for 8 weeks. Blood sample is taken at the baseline and 8 weeks from the baseline blood sample.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Will measure the diet of participants by food diary and analyse with Foodworks 2012
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measure the food diary at the start and end of the 8 week intervention

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Measure if energy has improved by questionnaires- start and end of intervention
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 8 weeks from start of intervention to completion

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Healthy, non-smokers, able to reach the The University of Auckland campus, male

trial_design.concealment:
Notices in elevators at university and surrounding area.
numbered containers
trial_design.statisticalmethods: ANOVA and linear model both used to compare gene expression changes after taking Olive Leaf extract. To detect a significant change (0.05) with a power of >80% in the JUN gene between the intervention groups, 30 participants are required. This was determined using the SD of a change in JUN in healthy people for a study using a similar nutracuetical.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This trial is to test the nutritional benefits of taking Olive leaf extract which is a strong antioxidant. There have been several trials with this extract demonstrating its potential to benefit health. This study aims to understand how the bioactive polyphenols in this extract work.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: HDEC- Health and Ethics Disability Committee New Zealand
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Ministry of Health, Ethics Department, PO Box 5013 Wellington 6145
